page.title: 14A NEW RESIDENT OF STRACHAN
page.content: {Primary 3 went to Mill of Strachan and {talked to a retired ambassador to the {Middle East,Major Strachan and his {Danish wife. 'In her house she has a large room, called her museum,full of presents and things collected over years.She also has a shop not yet opon.She is hoping to start a language school but needs a few more pupils. On their land she keeps Wensleydale & Jacob sheep and uses their wool for spinning.They have cows and also a dog and geese owned by their son.There is a which is deep and stocked with fish' 'We were taken to the language school hidden amongst the trees.One room was for beginners,another for those with a little knowledge of English and a third for quite advanced students.' {She will require accomodation locally {for these students. }continued p.15
